ul.li: Sketch curves using calculus and other qualitative characteristics of a function (domain, intercepts, asymptotes, symmetry)

subsection.title: Before Class

definition.title: Slant Asymptote
definition.p: If \ds \lim_{x\to \infty} \left[f(x)-(mx+b)\right] = 0, where m\neq 0, then the line y=mx+b is called a slant asymptote.
For rational functions, slant asymptotes occur when the degree of the numerator is one more than the degree of the denominator.

example.statement: Find the slant asymptote(s) for the function f(x) = \dfrac{3x^2}{x-1}.
Show that the hyperbola x^2-y^2 =1 has asymptotes at y = \pm x.

subsection.subsubsection:
Summary of Graphing We now have a guide for how to sketch the graph of most functions.
Guidelines for Curve Sketching
Find the domain of the function.
Identify x- and y-intercepts.
Locate symmetry in the graph, i.e. determine if the function is even, odd, periodic, etc.
Locate any asymptotes: vertical, horizontal, or slant.
Determine the intervals where the function is increasing or decreasing.
Find local maxima/minima.
Determine the intervals where the function is concave up/concave down.
With this information, you can confidently sketch the graph.

Describe how the graph of the function y = x^3 + cx varies as c varies. Graph several members of the family to illustrate the trends you discover. In particular, you should investigate how max/min points and inflection points move when c changes. Identify any transitional values of c at which the basic shape of the curve changes.

Describe how the graph of the function y =x\sqrt{c^2-x^2} varies as c varies. Graph several members of the family to illustrate the trends you discover. In particular, you should investigate how max/min points and inflection points move when c changes. Identify any transitional values of c at which the basic shape of the curve changes.

Investigate the family of curves given by the equation f(x) = x^4 + cx^2 + x. Start by determining the transitional values of c at which the number of inflection points changes. Then, graph several members of the family to see what shapes are possible. There is another transitional value of c at which the number of critical numbers changes. Try to discover it graphically, then prove what you have discovered.
